talk.author: did:plc:kzthzt6zncofstzf57tvkulf
talk.utter: If someone as rich as Steve Jobs couldn’t cure himself with alternative medicine that should tell you a lot about how effective it is by itself.

talk.author: did:plc:se4debq4u4jzwb5e5g5zkoe5
talk.utter: There are also alot of people not as rich as Jobs, who have used alternative medicine to cure themselves of cancer. Job's cancer is particularly nastier than most others

talk.author: did:plc:kzthzt6zncofstzf57tvkulf
talk.utter: What alternative medicine is it, and who are some of those people? I’m asking in good faith, not trying to be snarky.

talk.author: did:plc:kzthzt6zncofstzf57tvkulf
talk.utter: What alternative medicine is it, and who are some of those people? I’m asking in good faith, not trying to be snarky.

talk.author: did:plc:se4debq4u4jzwb5e5g5zkoe5
talk.utter: There's Essiac tea, some cancer treatments which have moved to Mexico due to FDA's suppressing in past, but Gerson Diet, Hoxsey Therapy as a few (searching on the internet will say these don't work). If they don't work, why is Mexico one of the top in the world of cancer treatment?

talk.author: did:plc:kzthzt6zncofstzf57tvkulf
talk.utter: I believe certain things in alternative medicine are useful. I drink turkey tail mushroom tea frequently, and use red light therapy. Certain things like these have a decent amount of research to back up their effectiveness. If you can’t find any evidence for something working, then I’d be-

talk.author: did:plc:kzthzt6zncofstzf57tvkulf
talk.utter: highly skeptical of them doing much beyond a placebo effect.
